Invocation

Delivered by: Rev. Maggie Howard, Pastor, Stapleton United AME Church, 49 Tompkins Avenue, Staten Island, NY 10304.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Rose.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Rev. Maggie Howard, Pastor, Stapleton United AME Church, 49 Tompkins Avenue, Staten Island, N.Y. 10304.

Council Member Rose moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to for-hire vehicle licenses.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: For-hire vehicle licenses.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring motion detectors for commercial buildings.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Requiring motion detectors for commercial buildings.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to publishing open data.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Technology
Items.MatterName: Publishing open data.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting general vendors from leaving pushcarts, stands or goods unattended.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting general vendors from leaving pushcarts, stands or goods unattended.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to extending J-51 benefits to owners of multiple dwellings for green roofs.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Extending J-51 benefits to owners of multiple dwellings for green roofs.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to introduce, and the Governor to sign, legislation which would authorize municipalities to create a loan program to assist small business owners in securing commercial lease space.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Small Business
Items.MatterName: Authorize municipalities to create a loan program to assist small business owners in securing commercial lease space.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to notifying tenants of city-owned buildings about the potential for tenant ownership prior to disposition.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Notifying tenants of city-owned buildings about the potential for tenant ownership prior to disposition.

Items.Title: Resolution urging the United States Congress to pass the Breast Cancer Patient Protection Act of 2009 (S. 688/H.R. 1691).
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Re-referred to Committee by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Congress to pass the Breast Cancer Patient Protection Act of 2005 (S. 688/H.R. 1691).

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York City Department of Education to develop a plan for the construction and/or renovation of school gymnasiums as part of its Five-Year Capital Plan to ensure that every school has adequate facilities in order to comply with New York State physical education requirements and to provide for healthy children and youth.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Dept of Education to develop a plan for the construction and/or renovation of school gymnasiums as part of its Five-Year Capital Plan.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the regulation of horse drawn cabs and repealing section 17-333 of the administrative code.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Regulation of horse drawn cabs.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to vending in Sunset Park, Brooklyn.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Vending in Sunset Park, Brooklyn.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of juvenile justice to report on demographic data.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Juvenile Justice
Items.MatterName: Requiring the department of juvenile justice to report on demographic data.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to banning the release of certain birds for ceremonial purposes.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Banning the release of certain birds for ceremonial purposes.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to pitching by high school children in competitive baseball games.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Youth Services
Items.MatterName: Pitching by high school children in competitive baseball games.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring exterior lighting to contain fully shielded fixtures.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Requiring exterior lighting to contain fully shielded fixtures.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the re-keying of lock cylinders in the entrance doors of multiple dwelling units at the beginning of each new tenancy.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: The re-keying of lock cylinders in the entrance doors of multiple dwelling units at the beginning of each new tenancy.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to an owner’s duty to purchase and install radiator covers.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: An owner’s duty to purchase and install radiator covers.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting obstructions or nuisances in or upon sidewalks, flagging or curbstones, streets and medians of streets and establishing a rebuttable presumption regarding responsibility for the placement of signs constituting such obstructions or nuisances.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting obstructing signs on sidewalks, flagging and curbstone whether or not abutting the offending property.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to creating one day temporary parking permits.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Creating one day temporary parking permits.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to allowing wheelchair accessible taxicabs to use Express Lanes or High Occupancy Vehicle (HOV) lanes.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Allowing wheelchair accessible taxicabs to use Express Lanes or High Occupancy Vehicle (HOV) lanes.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the creation of an office of road safety within the department of transportation.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Creation of an office of road safety within the department of transportation.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of transportation to create a plan for parking motorcycles.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Requiring the department of transportation to create a plan for parking motorcycles.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to an annual census of vacant properties.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Annual census of vacant properties.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting the display of wild or exotic animals for public entertainment or amusement.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting the display of wild or exotic animals for public entertainment or amusement.

Items.Title: Resolution urging the United States Congress to reintroduce and pass legislation that would amend the Public Health Service Act with respect to facilitating the development of microbicides for preventing transmission of HIV and other diseases.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Public Health Service Act with respect to facilitating the development of microbicides for preventing transmission of HIV and other diseases.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to the waterfront management advisory board.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Waterfronts
Items.MatterName: Waterfront management advisory board.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to creating a clean waterfront plan.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Waterfronts
Items.MatterName: Creating a clean waterfront plan.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to increasing fines for violations of the law for illegal dumping along waterfront property into New York city waterways.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Waterfronts
Items.MatterName: Increasing fines for violations of the law for illegal dumping along Waterfront property into NYC waterways.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to testing of local fish for health related risks and posting of subsistence fishing warnings in appropriate locations and conducting a public education campaign.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Testing of local fish for health related risks and posting of subsistence fishing warnings in appropriate locations and conducting a public education campaign.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the State Legislature and the Governor to support the passage of  A.5745 and S.3645 which would reinstate the modest tax on non-City residents known as the “commuter tax”  in the wake of the economic crisis facing New York City, so that New York City can continue to provide an adequate level of services to those who work and live in the City and can continue to serve as the economic engine for the state.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Reinstate the modest tax on non-City residents known as the “commuter tax” in the wake of the economic crisis facing NYC.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to cellular telephone service equipment and the inspection of the exterior walls of buildings greater than six stories in height.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Cellular telephone service equipment and the inspection of the exterior walls of buildings greater than six stories in height.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to biological, chemical and radiological detectors.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Biological, chemical and radiological detectors.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to amend the state’s Criminal Procedure Law to authorize a judge to consider a defendant’s “danger to the community” as a factor in bail decisions.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Amend the state’s Criminal Procedure Law to authorize a judge to consider a defendant’s “danger to the community” as a factor in bail decisions.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York City Department of Education to eliminate the fingerprinting fee for individuals seeking to volunteer in New York City public schools.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Dept of Education to eliminate the fingerprinting fee for individuals seeking to volunteer in NYC public schools.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Commercial recycling.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the posting of notices of provisions of the City’s Human Rights Law that relate to housing discrimination.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Rights
Items.MatterName: Posting of notices of provisions of the City’s Human Rights Law that relate to housing discrimination.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of education to distribute information on obtaining a library card and a library card application to all students.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Requiring the department of education to distribute information on obtaining a library card and a library card application to all students.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York in relation to the time at which discarded leaves may be placed out for collection from residential buildings.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Time at which discarded leaves may be placed out for collection from residential buildings.

Items.Title: Application no. 20105099 TCM, pursuant to §20-226 of the Administrative Code of the City of New York, concerning the petition of  Pam Real Thai II, Inc.. d/b/a Thai Encore  to continue, to maintain and operate an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 402 West 47th Street, Borough of Manhattan, Council District no. 3.  This application is subject to review and action by the Land Use Committee only if called-up by vote of the Council pursuant to Rule 11.20b of the Council and §20-226(g) of the New York City Administrative Code.

Items.MinutesNote: The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

The following files were removed from the General Order Calendar and voted separately:

Int No. 1, 38-9-1

See files for individual votes.
There is a vacancy in the Council (44th Council District) pending the results of a Special Election scheduled for Tuesday, March 23, 2010.
